item.title: Testing With Fake Data
item.description: I’ve recently come to the conclusion that maintaining test data is in most cases not helpful in conveying the intention of a unit test. Even worse, if the test data is not kept up-to-date with changing requirements, which will only add to the confusion as to what a particular unit test is trying to achieve. The approach I have been using recently is to randomly generate test data in my unit tests and only overwrite specific values if they are necessary for the test I am writing.
